author: Ignacio Escolar
title: Israel mata a 60 palestinos que buscaban comida en Gaza, seg√∫n cargos sanitarios de la Franja
text:
Fuerzas israel√≠es mataron ayer en Gaza a 60 personas, la mayor√≠a de las cuales se acercaban en busca de comida a uno de los centros patrocinados por Israel y EEUU para distribuir ayuda, seg√∫n las autoridades sanitarias de la Franja. Responsables m√©dicos aseguraron que al menos 25 palestinos fueron asesinados y decenas heridos de camino al centro de la Fundaci√≥n Humanitaria de Gaza (GHF, por sus siglas en ingl√©s), cerca de Netzarim, en el centro del enclave.
Los soldados israel√≠es mataron a otras 14 personas cerca de otro de los centros de reparto, en Rafah, ciudad pr√≥xima a la frontera sur. Estas muertes se suman a las 17 del martes, ocurridas en circunstancias similares.
El ej√©rcito hebrero recuper√≥, por otra parte, los cuerpos de dos rehenes israel√≠es de Gaza en colaboraci√≥n con el Shin Bet, el servicio de seguridad interior del pa√≠s. El primer ministro, Benjamin Netanyahu, public√≥ un comunicado en el que identifica a uno de los cuerpos como el de Yair Yaakov, de 59 a√±os, que fue secuestrado y asesinado por Ham√°s el 7 de octubre de 2023, en la incursi√≥n que caus√≥ la campa√±a de destrucci√≥n israel√≠. El otro cuerpo todav√≠a no ha sido identificado.
En Gaza quedan a√∫n 53 rehenes israel√≠es, pero se cree que la mayor√≠a de ellos est√°n muertos.
Las autoridades sanitarias de Gaza se√±alaron el mi√©rcoles que el saldo mortal tras 20 meses de campa√±a es de m√°s de 55.000 personas. El ministerio de sanidad formaba parte del Gobierno gestionado por Ham√°s, pero su personal es m√©dico y sus cifras son consideradas fiables por la ONU y otras organizaciones internacionales.
Cada vez son m√°s las muertes asociadas en los √∫ltimos d√≠as a los puntos de distribuci√≥n de comida de la GHF. El Centro por los Derechos Constitucionales, un despacho legal con sede en Nueva York, advirti√≥ a la fundaci√≥n de que ‚Äúpuede ser legalmente responsable por los cr√≠menes de guerra, contra la humanidad y el genocidio de Israel‚Äù.
‚ÄúLos palestinos se enfrentan ahora a una hambruna masiva mientras Israel se ha asociado con la GHF para que el acceso a la comida sea no solo peligroso y potencialmente letal, sino tambi√©n para hacer de esto una herramienta para el desplazamiento forzado [de personas]‚Äù, acus√≥ la jefa de abogados de la asociaci√≥n, Katherine Gallagher. ‚ÄúSi la GHF contin√∫a con sus operaciones militarizadas de reparto de ayuda, debe prepararse para las consecuencias legales tanto en Estados Unidos como m√°s all√°‚Äù, a√±adi√≥‚Äú.
La Corte Internacional de Justicia investiga al Gobierno israel√≠ y sus fuerzas armadas por acusaciones de genocidio, en parte por el supuesto uso de la comida como un arma contra la poblaci√≥n del territorio ocupado, de 2,2 millones de personas.
Los expertos humanitarios hab√≠an avisado previamente de que el sistema de distribuci√≥n de alimentos de la GHF desde unos pocos de centros fuertemente militarizados resultar√≠a muy peligroso para quienes se acercasen a por comida, que se ver√≠an obligados a pasar por zonas de combate.
El primer director ejecutivo de la fundaci√≥n, Jake Wood, dimiti√≥ el mes pasado por ir el plan contra ‚Äúlos principios humanitarios‚Äù.
La empresa de consultor√≠a estadounidense Boston Consulting Group, que ayud√≥ a poner en marcha la GHF, cort√≥ lazos con esta la semana pasada. Johnnie Moore, l√≠der evang√©lico y asesor religioso de Donald Trump, un firme defensor de Israel con m√≠nima experiencia en labores humanitarias, fue nombrado director en su lugar.
Las Fuerzas de Defensa de Israel, el ej√©rcito hebreo, dijeron que los soldados hab√≠an efectuado ‚Äúdisparos de advertencia‚Äù por la noche a un grupo que les parec√≠a amenazador. ‚ÄúY esto a pesar de que se ha avisado de que el √°rea es una zona de combate activo. Las FDI est√°n al corriente de las informaciones sobre sujetos heridos; se est√°n comprobando los detalles‚Äù, indicaron.
La GHF declar√≥ a Reuters que no le constaban los incidentes del mi√©rcoles, pero a√±adi√≥ que trabajaba codo con codo con las autoridades israel√≠es para garantizar el paso franco en las rutas, y que era esencial que los palestinos siguiesen las instrucciones al pie de la letra.
‚ÄúLa soluci√≥n fundamental es [dar] m√°s ayuda, lo que dar√° seguridad a la poblaci√≥n y reducir√° la urgencia‚Äù, sostuvo. ‚ÄúA√∫n no hay comida suficiente para alimentar a todos los que la necesitan en Gaza. Ahora nos centramos en dar de comer a tanta gente como sea posible con seguridad, con las limitaciones que presenta el entorno, que es muy vol√°til‚Äù, adujo.
Moore public√≥ un mensaje en redes sociales en el que detall√≥ que hab√≠a visitado un centro de empaquetado y distribuci√≥n de la GHF en Israel y afirm√≥ que la organizaci√≥n suministr√≥ el mi√©rcoles 2,5 millones de comidas. Con esto, ser√≠an 16 millones de comidas las repartidas desde que la organizaci√≥n empez√≥ a trabajar, el 27 de mayo.
La GHF acus√≥ a Ham√°s a √∫ltima hora del mi√©rcoles de matar a al menos cinco personas en un ataque a un autob√∫s que trasladaba a uno de sus puntos de distribuci√≥n a dos docenas de palestinos que trabajaban para la organizaci√≥n. ‚ÄúSeguiremos con nuestra misi√≥n de proveer de ayuda cr√≠tica para la poblaci√≥n de Gaza‚Äù, afirm√≥ en un comunicado.
El grupo promotor de los derechos civiles israel√≠ Adalah advirti√≥, tambi√©n el mi√©rcoles, de que el grupo de activistas internacionales capturados por Israel en un barco en el Mediterr√°neo oriental estaba en r√©gimen de aislamiento.
La asociaci√≥n inform√≥ en un comunicado de que Tiago √Åvila, uno de los arrestados, est√° en la prisi√≥n de Ayal√≥n, por ‚Äúsu huelga de hambre y sed, que comenz√≥ hace dos d√≠as‚Äù.
La eurodiputada franco-palestina Rima Hassan, que tambi√©n iba en el barco, fue igualmente aislada tras escribir ‚ÄúPalestina libre‚Äù en un muro de la prisi√≥n de Neve Tiza.
Qu√© se sabe de la matanza de palestinos en un punto de reparto de comida en Gaza
‚ÄúLa metieron en una celda peque√±a y sin ventanas, en unas condiciones higi√©nicas extremadamente malas y no se le permiti√≥ acceder al patio de la c√°rcel‚Äù, censur√≥ Adalah. La organizaci√≥n apunt√≥ que Hassan sali√≥ del aislamiento el mi√©rcoles. El ministerio israel√≠ de Exteriores no respondi√≥ inmediatamente a estas acusaciones.

author: Abigale Schreier
title: 10 Tips for Getting Great Family Photos with a Toddler
text:
When friends compliment those cute black-and-white family photos hanging on your wall they have no idea what went down behind the scenes‚Äîsweat-drenched parents desperately begging their tots to look at the camera and offering progressively wilder bribes to a little kid who‚Äôs suddenly decided pants are optional. Trying to wrangle a toddler for a
family photo shoot is a special kind of challenge for any mom or dad who just wants a few nice snaps to hang on the wall and share with family and friends on Tinybeans. Aside from ditching the poses and taking natural shots that lend themselves to your tot‚Äôs boundless energy, there‚Äôs also the matter of managing your expectations and working with your little one‚Äôs unpredictability versus fighting against it. Read on for tips to help you get a set of family photos you‚Äôll truly love.
Find a local photographer who does minis
Minis are a great, less expensive way to get family photos. Plus, the shorter the period that your toddler has to focus, the better. And don‚Äôt worry that your photographer won‚Äôt have enough time to get the shot because they‚Äôre professionals and used to this, says
family photographer Jalyn Clemens.
Don‚Äôt force your toddler to look at the camera
Posed shots are out, and fun, natural photos are in. If your toddler isn‚Äôt looking at the camera, that‚Äôs okay. ‚ÄúIf one person isn‚Äôt looking at the camera it‚Äôs best that all of you are not,‚Äù says Clemens. ‚ÄúJust keep talking and smiling at your toddler or partner because smiling at the people you love is way cuter.‚Äù
Never stop moving
Clemens says if you never stop moving, it gives your photos a more natural look. Plus,
toddlers never stop moving anyway, so this one should be easy!
Let go of expectations
‚ÄúLet go of any and all expectations of how your session should go,‚Äù Clemens says. ‚ÄúA good photographer will adapt to the session and to your family‚Äôs personality and can just go with the flow.‚Äù Besides, your toddler might lead you to some
weird and wonderful results.
Be yourselves
Most photographers will say it‚Äôs best to just be yourselves and let the photographer tell your story. If your kid loves to run and roll on the ground, great! Follow them and laugh along as they do it. Do you like playing on the ground with your toddler? Perfect! Get on the floor and make some photo magic.
Scope out your location early
‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre doing it outside your house, get to your location a little early,‚Äù Clemens suggests. ‚ÄúKids have a natural desire to explore‚Äîor they could feel a little bit nervous at a new location‚Äîso arriving early can give your kid a sense of security and confidence.‚Äù This will also increase the likelihood of your tot staying close to you, as they already had a chance to explore.
Try to let your toddler have fun
If everyone is stressed and tense and getting hollered at for not posing right, the photos will definitely reflect that. Tracy Englund, with
This Is You Photography, says to let your toddler have fun while they‚Äôre there. They‚Äôll lighten up, and you will, too, which makes for some sweet, relaxed, happy photos.
Give them fun toddler-friendly props
Englund says whether it‚Äôs
a book, bubbles, a toy, or even a mirror (they do love looking at themselves), giving your toddler a prop to play with and focus on will make your photos stand out.
Have someone stand behind the photographer
By positioning someone familiar behind the camera with a favorite toy or a particularly silly face, you have a better chance of your toddler looking in the right direction (and maybe even dropping that million-dollar smile).
Bribery is always an option
We‚Äôre not above bribery for family photos with a toddler and Englund agrees. It always works, but she notes that if the photographer is the one doing the bribing they should first check with the parents and make sure they‚Äôre okay with the treats or toys on offer.
When you‚Äôve got more beautiful candids than you know what to do with, share them with your family and friends near and far on the
Tinybeans app. The secure platform puts parents in total control of who sees and interacts with photos and videos of their kids.

text:

VYSN SmartHold 360¬∞ Rotation Smart AI Gimbal. This AI-powered camera tool allows you to record the best videos possible, and right now, it's on sale. Usually available for just $99, you can get it now for only $49.99.

VYSN SmartHold 360¬∞ Rotation Smart AI Gimbal makes video recording easier and more efficient than ever. While it usually costs $99, you can now get it for just $49.99. That's an entire 50% off ‚Äî no coupons needed!

author: Kevin Bessler | The Center Square
title: Like what you see?
text:
(The Center Square) ‚Äì An annual rite of summer in Illinois is approaching soon with another increase in the state‚Äôs gas tax along with a slew of other tax increases.
In total, Illinois will see $1.1 billion in tax hikes over the next year. They will support a record-high $53.1 billion state budget.
Taxes for gasoline will be 47 cents per gallon and 54 cents per gallon for diesel. The gas tax hike means Illinois drivers will have to pay an average of $184 more per year on gas than they did in 2019.
The increase is part of the Rebuild Illinois capital plan. In 2019, lawmakers voted to double the gas tax from 19 cents per gallon to 38 cents per gallon with annual increases tied to inflation. Illinois is one of just a few states that also assesses its sales tax on top of the gas tax.
‚ÄúWhen you add up what people pay in gas taxes at the federal, state and local level, Illinois pays the second most in gas taxes in the nation to only California and obviously the highest in the Midwest by far,‚Äù said Dylan Sharkey, an editor with Illinois Policy Institute.
By comparison, Missouri is also raising the motor fuel tax on July 1 to 27 cents per gallon, according to the Missouri Department of Revenue.
Also on July 1, electric vehicle owners in Illinois will be charged a $100 yearly fee to make up for lost tax revenue, on top of the annual registration fee.
Video game taxes will increase by 1 percentage point, to 35%, and the sports wagering tax will rise for sportsbook operators. The tax will move from a 15% flat rate to a progressive rate of up to 35%.
Sharkey said Illinois is near the top of many lists for the wrong reasons.
‚ÄúIt would be one thing if we had just had the second highest gas tax in the country, but we also have the second highest corporate income tax rate and the second highest property tax rate, so it is one thing to be atop of one ranking, but Illinois being constantly near the top for all of them goes to show you that people are losing out in multiple ways,‚Äù said Sharkey.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Cardinals Defensive Line Emerges as Most Improved After Free Agency
text:
Cardinals Defensive Line Emerges as Most Improved After Free Agency
The Arizona Cardinals have significantly improved their defensive line through NFL free agency, as highlighted by PFF's Max Chadwick. The unit, previously ranked 28th in the league, added key players including edge rusher Josh Sweat and defensive tackle Dalvin Tomlinson. With an investment of nearly $125 million, the Cardinals aim to enhance their pass-rush capability and overall defensive performance, moving past last year's struggles that saw them with the fifth-lowest-graded defensive line.
- Cardinals' defensive line ranked 28th in the NFL last season.
- Josh Sweat registered 10.5 sacks in the regular season and playoffs combined last year.
- Dalvin Tomlinson logged 16 tackles and four sacks with the Cleveland Browns in 2024.
- Arizona invested nearly $125 million in its defensive front.
- Cardinals had 41 total sacks last season, ranking 13th in the NFL.
- Key free-agent additions have been made to bolster both edge and interior defensive positions.
- Injuries affected performance last season, with a focus on improving health for key players in 2025.
- Re-signing of outside linebacker Baron Browning aims to stabilize the edge rusher situation.
The Cardinals will be looking to integrate their new signings into the defense, aiming for greater consistency and performance in the upcoming season. They'll monitor the development of Darius Robinson, hoping for a strong sophomore season to further solidify the defensive line. Enhanced health and reduced injuries will be vital contributors to the team's success.
Bottom LineThe Cardinals are poised for a defensive resurgence after substantial investments in their line, with hopes that new player additions and improved health can lead to a much stronger performance in 2025. The blend of experience and youth could be the key to turning around the team's defensive fortunes.
Read more at Arizona Sports

author: TNM Staff
title: Karnataka Legislative Council rejects proposal to collect 10% tax from rich temples
text:
The Congress government faced a setback as the Legislative Council on Friday, February 24 did not approve the proposed amendments to the Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Act, 1997. These amendments aimed to offer social security measures to more than 40,000 priests of Muzrai temples in the state, along with other proposed changes. When the Bill was approved in the Legislative Assembly, it faced opposition from the BJP who accused the Siddaramaiah government of stealing wealth from rich temples in the state.
Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy, who introduced the amendments in the Legislative Assembly on Wednesday, said that the money would be used for providing various amenities to temples, offering insurance coverage and death relief to temple priests and granting scholarships to approximately 40,000 children of priest families. He said, ‚ÄúThe funds will be managed by Rajya Dharmika Parishad and will primarily be allocated to provide aid to Group C temples and provide welfare measures to priests and their families at these temples.‚Äù
During the debate in Council, the amendment Bill encountered opposition to certain provisions from Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Janata Dal (Secular) members. It was ultimately defeated after it was put to a voice vote by Deputy Chairman MK Pranesh, given the combined opposition's majority in the Council.
The opposition objected to several proposals, including the inclusion of 10% of the gross income from 87 temples earning over Rs 1 crore annually, and 5% of gross income from 311 temples earning over Rs 10 lakh annually, into a Common Pool Fund administered by Rajya Dharmika Parishath. This fund was intended for the welfare of priests and the maintenance of over 34,000 'C' category temples earning less than Rs 5 lakh annually. This proposal differed from the 2011 amendment, where 5% of the net income from temples earning between Rs 5 lakh and Rs 10 lakh annually, and 10% of the net income from temples earning over Rs 10 lakh annually, were directed to the fund.
During the debate on the Bill in the Council, Leader of the Opposition Kota Srinivas Poojary, who previously held the Muzrai portfolio during the BJP regime, expressed support for the initiative to offer social security measures to priests employed in over 34,000 'C' category temples. However, he objected to the proposal of allocating 10% of the gross income from temples earning over Rs 1 crore to the Common Pool Fund. Additionally, he opposed the idea of the government nominating the president of the temple committee, advocating instead for the committee to select its president from among its members.
Ramalinga Reddy offered to amend the Bill, expressing the government's willingness to forego the nomination of the president and potentially reduce the percentage allocated to the common pool. He said that the government intended to provide financial assistance for housing, children's education, and insurance to priests in 'C' category temples, estimating an expected revenue of about Rs 60 crore from the proposal, with Rs 25 crore designated for the upkeep of 'C' category temples. He noted that the previous BJP government in 2011 had similarly allocated 10% of temples' net collections to the Common Pool Fund.
Responding to Srinivas‚Äôs suggestion of allotting specified amounts in the budget, the Minister also acknowledged the challenge of securing funds annually and suggested that earmarking the amount in the budget might not guarantee consistent provision in subsequent years.
When the opposition pressed for changes before passing the Bill, the Minister requested time until Monday to consult with the Chief Minister due to the financial implications. However, the Deputy Speaker, MK Pranesh, presiding over the session, deemed postponement impractical as the Bill had already been considered. He adjourned the House briefly to allow leaders to reach an agreement. Upon reconvening, he proceeded to put the Bill to a vote, resulting in its defeat.

author: FOX 9 Staff
title: Minneapolis Park Police find hundreds of fentanyl pills during arrest: charges
text:
MINNEAPOLIS (FOX 9) - A man is facing serious drug charges after Minneapolis Park Police found hundreds of pills that tested positive for fentanyl during an arrest before Christmas Eve near Elliot Park.
Minneapolis Park Police Chief Jason Ohotto says the suspect, identified as Bernard Mack, was arrested during a patrol around Elliot Park -- which has been a hot spot for crime .
"In 2023, Elliot Park has experienced at least 13 reported serious violent crimes," explained Chief Ohotto. "That leads all Minneapolis parks."
On the night of Dec. 23, police attempted to stop a vehicle that was registered to a man with an active warrant. However, the vehicle pulled off to the side of the street and four people jumped out and ran away.
The driver, Mack, who police say was the wanted man, ran southbound, eventually reaching a fence near East 19th Street. Police say Mack tried to jump the fence, but couldn't quite make it. He was arrested shortly thereafter.
Searching his person, police found more than $2,500 in cash. In the backyard, officers found 1,788 that field tested positive for fentanyl.
"This quantity of fentanyl is extraordinary, for a street-level drug arrest, and could have hurt or killed countless numbers of our neighbors," said Chief Ohotto.
In the abandoned vehicle, officers found more fentanyl pills and two cell phones, along with a box of sandwich bags. In the trunk, officers found a .45 caliber handgun with an extended magazine and multiple rounds.
Mack is being held in Hennepin County Jail on an aggravated drug charge.
